Reviews.Title: Real Baluns unlike some others sold on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Blade "Blade"
Reviews.Content: A real Balun has a resistive circuit built in, without it, they are only a cable adapter.  These worked great to eliminate ghosting and roll bars I was getting with a cheaper set (the black and green kind).  Construction isn't fantastic, but good enough to get the job done.

Reviews.Title: Work
Reviews.Author: J J
Reviews.Content: They seem to work fine,  just bulky,  barely able to fit on back side of dvr.  I used CAT 6 cable with them and used it to feed 2 cameras,  have seen to double up the power wires but my runs were less than 25 feet so I thought I would try and use one cable for 2 cameras close to each other and works fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: justin dysart "Justin"
Reviews.Content: These are great for converting Cat5e to an Audio or Video signal. I have used them for subwoofers and to send the signal from a Nintendo Wii to a TV or receiver across a room. I use them with BNC Female Jack to RCA Male Plug Adapters and love them.

Reviews.Title: Great price for multiple sets
Reviews.Author: EK406
Reviews.Content: This is great for adding that last minute camera to a live event, cheap but good quality baluns are delivered reliably. This balun is compact but of sufficient size to support several twisted pair wire sizes with simple hand tools. Try it, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: no pigtail
Reviews.Author: S. Eckert
Reviews.Content: They work, they're great, but the picture is misleading. They're all the same, not in pairs, and none of them have pigtails. Make sure you have room: total length is almost 2 inches, and the wires exit the box on the square end. They're small enough to fit on adjacent terminals but do stick out quite far from the DVR.

Reviews.Title: Solid Balun for CCTV
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I needed to have a long run for CAT6 cable to hook up my home video security system.  (Qsee brand).  These Baluns allowed me to run 4 cameras off a single CAT6 run.  There was no noticeable degration in the video clarity or camer performance.  Great deal and saved me lots of money compared to running individual RG 59 runs for each camera.

Reviews.Title: Cheap price, small size, and works great...
Reviews.Author: FuFa
Reviews.Content: UTP-Coax video baluns are the easiest way to hook up analog video cameras for a home CCTV setup, and these little buggers do the job just fine.  They are priced well, and work great.  All you need is a small screwdriver to secure each wire in place.NOTES ABOUT USING BALUNS FOR CCTV VIDEO:Video baluns are great, and can make your install faster, cheaper, and with less interference than running separate coax/power cables (or buying expensive siamese cable). Instead of running a thick coax cable and a separate power cable to each camera, you only have to run a single UTP (cat5, cat5e, cat6) cable.  Use one color pair for the video and parallel the other 3 pairs for camera power.  You will need some male DC power connectors as well (unless you want to splice, solder, and heat shrink the wires instead).  I would also highly recommend using a separate wall-mount CCTV camera power supply box with individually fused outputs.  Not only it is safer, but when running power over UTP cable, this makes for a much neater, more professional looking installation, as opposed to using the cheap laptop type power bricks with power splitter cables that often come with most home CCTV systems.

Reviews.Title: Great connector
Reviews.Author: Charles M. Moughamian
Reviews.Content: Used all of them and no drop in video. Easy to use and install. If you are running your own line set this will do the trick.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: dougm
Reviews.Content: once figured out the right way to hook them up they worked just as advertised. This is the way to go usinr cat5e cable.

Reviews.Title: These are good baluns
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: I've been using these baluns for a couple of months now and could not be more pleased.  They replaced some older ones that seemed to have been causing some intermittent video issues with my system.  Since switching them out, I've had no further problems.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Diego Reina
Reviews.Content: I really liked this model because it is hard to install or place in a 16-channel DVR, put your fingers is difficult when you've already placed several.

ProductInfo.Name: 4 PAIRS (8 Pcs.) Mini CCTV BNC Video Balun`, Passive
